page.title: 07HOTELS-PETWOOD
page.content: The Petwood Hotel used to be the mess of the Dambusters Squadron who were responsible for the famous bombing raids on German dams in World War Two. The area of the grounds is 40 acres. The building is built in a timbered style and was completed in 1905.The entrance is only 100 metres from the Jubilee Leisure Park.In 1980 it became a privately owned hotel.It has 35 bedrooms and can take up to 60 guests. There are facilties for private dinners and conferences.Dog shows and car rallies are also held.A discotheque is open five nights per week and plans are afoot for the building of a swimming pool and a caravan park.
